content: I have been enjoying Python's relatively new "f strings" feature.
I guess they were added in 3.6. @Vishnu Ks Have you had a chance to play with them?
@Steve Howell I honestly didn't knew they existed untill now. Can't wait to start using them in Zulip once we deprecate 3.5.
I guess that is not going to happen anytime soon.
Yeah, they will really improve certain pieces of code.

Most of the Zulip backend code uses templates to produce non-trivial content, so it might not make a dramatic difference for Zulip. But for zulip-archive it was a great alternative to old-school format statements (and prevented the need for a heavier templating approach).
@Steve Howell format is now old-school? :)
I don't quite have 3.8 yet, but while a little niche, I think the debug f-strings will be useful too.
haha, yep, I consider format old-school now :) Of course, string interpolation goes way, way back.
